answers.answer: Hello,I am RN not MD:Could be related to your thyroid...do you have any thyroid issues in family history or yourself?  Thyroid issues can cause numbness and/or tingling in extremeties often.Could be pinched nerve...how is you spinal column?  any issues of hurniation?Take note of how, when, duration and alleviation of pins and needles and show that to your MD on next visit.  I'd say make this recording for a month before revisit to MD to show any trends.Good luck and hope this helped.

Hello and hope you are doing well.The most probable cause for the pins and needles sensation in the foot is neuropathy, a disorder of the nerves. Most common cause is diabetes. This happens with metabolic disorders, vitamin deficiencies, infections and traumatic injuries. The tingling and palpitations need proper evaluation by your GP, please consult him for a neurological assessment.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: i am a 38 year old female for the last 2 or 3 months i have been getting pins and needles in my right foot it lasts for about 5 to 10 minutes and it happens a few times a day
title: pins and needles
